intro: Buchenavia stellae, commonly known as the starleaf buchenavia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves and clusters of pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Buchenavia stellae is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
